properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Spring storm over Eastern Quebec this weekend A coastal low pressure system from New England will reach the Gaspé Peninsula on Saturday. Strong winds and significant snowfall amounts are expected with this system. However, there is still some uncertainty as to the track of this low, which could significantly impact snowfall amounts. On Sunday, the combination of strong winds and high tides will be favourable for breaking sea conditions along the coast of Gaspé Peninsula. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-08T17:39:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-08T01:40:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2317573341.2020
Area: Mont-Joli area, Le Bic - Rimouski area, Rimouski Wildlife Reserve area, Matane, Amqui area, Matapédia area, Grande-Vallée area, Sainte-Anne-des-Monts area, Murdochville area, Mont-Albert area, Grande-Rivière - Cascapédia area, New-Richmond - Bonaventure area, Restigouche - Carleton area, Chandler area, New Carlisle - Port-Daniel area, Forillon National Park - Gaspé area, Percé area
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory until early in the morning. Scattered bands of snow are expected to affect the regions into the morning. Visibility could be quite poor at times locally. Snowfall amounts are expected to be quite variable with some areas receiving a centimetre or less while others could receive 5 cm or more locally. Please consult your local forecast for details on expected snowfall amounts in your region. This will create winter driving conditions in many areas and temperatures dropping below the freezing may may cause slippery conditions. Conditions will improve through the morning as the heaviest snow bands dissipate. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-08T20:31:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-08T04:32:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2826495948.2020
Area: Greater Sudbury and vicinity, Temiskaming Shores - Temagami, West Nipissing - French River, North Bay - Powassan - Mattawa, Espanola - Killarney
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions are expected over western sections of Ungava Bay this evening. Conditions are expected to gradually improve by Friday morning. A blizzard warning is issued when winds are expected to produce blowing snow causing widespread visibilities of 400 metres or less for at least 6 hours. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-08T13:59:08-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-08T01:34:08-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2334113707.2020
Area: Quaqtaq, Kangirsuk, Aupaluk
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blowing snow expected today through Sunday. Northerly winds will strengthen this morning across the region. These winds, combined with freshly falling snow, may give visibilities near zero at times from today through Sunday morning. Gusts of up to 70 km/h are expected by this afternoon. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-09T02:59:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-08T11:00:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1388662265.2020
Area: Fort Severn, Peawanuck

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Temperatures will drop to near or below the freezing mark overnight tonight. In addition, the relatively cool weather for this time of the year will continue for several more days. As a result, the frost advisory for Southwestern Quebec could be maintained for all nights and mornings through the rest of this week, possibly through Tuesday morning. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-09T00:25:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-08T08:26:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2850035261.2020

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant snowfall expected this weekend. Total snowfall: 15 cm or more in some areas. Location: New Brunswick. Time span: Saturday morning through Sunday morning. Remarks: A mix of snow and rain is expected to spread across New Brunswick Saturday morning and continue through Saturday night. Current forecast guidance indicates that that the greatest snowfall accumulations will likely be over northern regions, with the heaviest snowfall rates Saturday night. The snow will taper to flurries on Sunday morning, which will be accompanied by brisk northwesterly winds. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-09T02:26:24-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-08T10:27:24-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0714833224.2020

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may destroy crops. Frost is likely again tonight with temperatures dropping to near or below zero. Hazard: Frost and freeze conditions. Timing: Reoccurring nightly through Tuesday. Impact: Frost-sensitive crops and plants could be damaged or killed by frost. Action: Take preventative measures to protect frost-sensitive crops and plants. An extended period of significantly colder than normal temperatures will result in several days of frost and, at times, hard freezes across much of Southern Ontario. These conditions are expected to persist through Tuesday. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-09T01:54:32-00:00

properties.Title: Storm Surge Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Coastal flood warning issued jointly by Fisheries and Oceans Canada (Science) and the Meteorological Service of Canada - Quebec Region on May 8, 2020. Higher than normal water levels due to the spring freshet combined with the current run of high-amplitude tidal ranges could cause minor coastal flooding in the vicinity of the following locality on the dates and at the times specified (Eastern Daylight Time). Quebec City: 2020-05-08, from 06:30 AM to 08:30 AM. Quebec City: 2020-05-09, from 07:30 AM to 09:30 AM. Quebec City: 2020-05-10, from 08:00 AM to 10:00 AM. ### Coastal erosion is possible in vulnerable areas. Storm surge warnings are issued when water levels pose a threat to coastal regions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-05-09T00:18:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-05-08T08:19:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3882597490.2020
Area: Québec area, Côte-de-Beaupré - L'Île d'Orléans area, Bellechasse area, Lévis area
